From tap pours golden with light head.  Smell of floral citrusy hops.  Taste is incredibly smooth a caramel smooth, slightly sweet start with a following of floral, apricot-like hoppiness.  There is some bitterness but it blends well with the sweet smoothness.  The alcohol is not very noticible over most other beers.  This beer will not last long at most pubs.  Jump on it while you can.  Its great.

Tap @ Bistro - Hayward: Gold color with an apricot aroma as well as greenery.  The flavor is sweet and hoppy followed by an extremely smooth feel.  The alcohol is completely masked  which is impressive.  You could easily throw back two pints of this and be in big trouble without realizing it until you puked your guts out.  Yummy!  That is, the beer, not the puking.

growler contributed by drewbeerme.  mega huge thanks for finally be able to try this and let me tell you, it was well worth the wait.....poured a semi opague orangey brown with a soapy milky white head......a nice tropical hop nose, grapefruit and other citrus notes contributed to a very alluring aroma.  there was some nice sweetness to go along with it as well.....this had a fantastically smooth flavor.  a huge dose of tropical fruit, very clean throughout.  this had a sweeter flavor profile than most iipas w/ very little bitterness at all (just a tad in the finish)......after two full pours of this, i was definitely ready for another growler. exquisitely tasty.

Enjoyed this op tap at Flanigans Boathouse in Summer 2006, just rating it now for some reason.  Maybe Im just sobering up from that strange, Mid-afternoon event, held on Monday of all days.  Fresh bursts of pinecones and grapefruits on the nose, with a lingering sweetness.  Orange body, slightly darker than its elder kindred.  Just such a wonderful flavor, an explosion of the aforementioned, more candi sugar than the Elder, swirling lighter fruits mingle into an extraordinarily balanced, large, and impressive IIPA.
Right up there with the best.  Youll have no idea how much alcohol you are drinking.  The smell, flavor, and texture are astounding.

Growler filled 8 days earlier, with a HUGE thanks to Drewbeerme.  I never thought Id be able to try this one.  But now I got two full pours.  Clear orange with an off white head.  Caramel malt backbone with tropical fruit.  Mangos, grapefruit, lemons, pine.  There is a slight sour note as well as perfume. Flavor is sweet and smooth.  More of that tropical fruit.  Creamy and balanced well.  There is no hint of that 11% until this really starts to warm up.  Dangerously drinkable.  Finishes with a drying bitter sweet pine finish.  The tropical fruit really reminded me of Big Eddy IIPA.  An excellent excellent beer.  Thanks andrew!

On tap at the city beer store in San Francisco.   I had this at about noon on Super Bowl Sunday when buying a nice selection of beer for my Super Bowl Party.   Poured a nice orange brown color.   On my first taste, my reaction was  Wow!.   Very nice balance of the hoppiness with the sweetness.   The hoppiness wins out, but that is the desired effect.   Anyway, if you ever drink this on an empty stomach for brunch, you will definitely feel the alcohol afterwards.  But I wasnt driving so ...

sample from a growler filled 8 days ago and traded to me by Abusedgoat. Big thanks to Dan for trading this highly soaght after beer and pantanap for contributing in the trade. pours dense golden with creamy white head. nose is loaded with tropical fruity hop notes and sugar, along with some grapefruit and piney notes. flavor is pretty much the same. a wonderful balance and extremely drinkable. i could drink a whole growler to myself happily. i think it could stand some more bitterness to balance the sweet notes. alcohol is very very well hidden. carbonation is low and the feel is really smooth. the body is a bit light to medium. a wonderful clean fruity finish that begs for more. and i drank more. i grew up on dreadnaught and this belongs right with it but not as complex. a wonderful ale.

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2013 Following a pint which knocked my socks off, I filled my Growler, brought it home and poured another small glass. I have waited a long time for this to be available and it was worth the wait.  Without a doubt the best over the top DIPA I have ever partaken, and this is my favorite beer type.  I took my time with this.   Poured a hazy gold tending toward orange with a soap suds head that left big chucks of lacing. Huge citrus hops nose, and a rich mouthfeel that feels like port wine on the palate.    Flavors are citrus hops and the finish is long and bitter, but enjoyably so.  The alcohol presence made this a bit "hot" and kept if from being a 5.0.  I was prepared to be disappointed after the long wait, but this is the best brew ever for me.  So sad I only have a growler.  I really love this beer.

Draft at brewpub: Slightly hazy orange, good lacing and retention. Aroma is basically a bigger version of the Elder... huge PNW grapefruit/citrus notes. Medium to heavy body, big big bitterness, some alcohol. Monster flavors with finesse, but lacks the complexity of Dreadnaught.

Simply put, this is one of the best extreme IPAs Ive ever had. Mild sweetness, and the bitterness is well pronounced troughout with highlights of citrus, and do I dare say a I notice a slight pine taste well hidden in the backside? Very drinkable, and I could easily session this beer all night long. If you get a chance to drink this jewel in the Santa Rosa /San Fransisco area, make it a must.
One of the best DIPAs around. Super hoppy on both the nose and on the palate. Thick, syrupy, and heavy in the mouth. Definitely tastes like an 11% beer. Is there a category for a triple IPA?
Had it on tap at the brewery while headed north. Taste like sucking on fresh hop. Almost stings the tounge at first. Thick and chewy. This was a great smack in the face!!!

Sllightly hazy orangish-gold color with small head. Sharp grapefruit and citrus aroma with a hint of the alcohol to come. Taste is sweet with a subtle, but obvious, alcohol burn. Its not the biggest hop bomb ever, but is balanced oh so nicely. The sugary sweetness and alcohol are never too far behind the hops. Even this hand bottle session was quite fizzy, and the bitterness is bearable.

cloudy orange, frothy off white head, streaks of lace, sweet citrus aroma, huge sticky sweet citrus flavor, sugar laden grapefruit, not a lot a complexity but lots of flavor,

Rating this beer from a "handbottle" is totally wrong, but damn it is so good even like this that I will do it anyway - The most beautiful deep golden slightly hazy body with a big very white medium sized bubbled head; Medium sized quite elegant nose, it aint big but just a little down is a very dense mass of very well organized hop aromas, somehow the nose feels like a mass of explosives covered by a fresh layer of velvety fine snow; The body is very fine very bitter very sweet and incredible well composed and accompanied by the most perfect texture, the body has the same feel as the nose; like something very near exploding covered or smoothened by something very fine; It does explode though!!! The finish is an explosion of huge dimensions if all the aspects of the hop flower, balanced perfectly by the sweetness of an IPA with a high alcohol %, the huge amount of bitterness and aromas of the finish are incredibly well managed, actually incredibly, incredibly well managed, very impressive.
